item.title: Criticizing design articles because I can
item.description: This article on form design seems perfectly innocuous. It’s a helpful guide that lays out best practices and briefly describes why they’re better than the obvious alternative.

item.title: That Fitbit rant
item.description: While we’re at it, here’s another design rant that’s been percolating within me like a fine wine. So, I have a Fitbit. Due to my chronic illness I need to keep an eye on my (unusually high) heart rate, which is why I originally bought the thing; it turns out to also be very useful for tracking my sleep.

item.title: Design: Edge Cases and Legibility
item.description: From A Designer’s Code of Ethics: A designer does not believe in edge cases. When you decide who you’re designing for, you’re making an implicit statement about who you’re not designing for.
